title: Deliver EPC and O&M packages to Gridora infrastructure pipeline
description: IHC, ADQ and Modon launched Gridora to accelerate strategic infrastructure in the UAE and globally. With Real Estate & Construction and Marine & Dredging driving revenue, Gridora will procure large EPC, equipment, and long-term O&M contracts for utilities, transport, industrial zones and social infrastructure.
example: Siemens Energy and ABB can supply high-voltage substations and grid digitalization for a new industrial zone in Abu Dhabi delivered by Gridora; Bechtel or Hyundai E&C can form a consortium with Modon to build a desalination-linked industrial water network; Arabtec’s successor entities or ACC can deliver housing and community assets under a design-build-finance-maintain model; Johnson Controls can deploy building automation and energy efficiency retrofits for Gridora-managed public buildings with performance-based O&M.
roadmap: Identify Gridora’s near-term tenders via Modon’s vendor portal and pre-qualify as EPC/O&M supplier
Form a consortium covering design, EPC, finance (export credit/green sukuk) and O&M to meet PPP requirements
Propose pilot packages (e.g., 132kV substation, district cooling, modular schools) with capex/opex optimization
Secure local content partners and arrange equipment staging in Abu Dhabi industrial zones
Negotiate long-term maintenance SLAs tied to availability KPIs and energy performance
Scale internationally with Gridora’s pipeline using the same consortium template
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Integrate and distribute the UAE Dirham-backed stablecoin
description: IHC, ADQ and First Abu Dhabi Bank announced a UAE Dirham-backed stablecoin to enhance digital payments and blockchain innovation. Fintechs, PSPs, exchanges, and remittance firms can integrate it for faster settlement, on/off-ramps, and cross-border flows.
example: Checkout.com and Network International can enable merchant settlement in the dirham stablecoin to reduce T+ settlement costs for UAE e-commerce; Wise and Western Union can offer low-cost remittances to South Asia with instant on-ramp/off-ramp via FAB; Coinbase and Rain can list the stablecoin in ADGM, offering institutional custody for regional corporates’ treasury; Pyypl and Wio Bank can embed the stablecoin for SME payroll and supplier payments, minimizing FX slippage.
roadmap: Engage IHC/ADQ/FAB working group to obtain API specs, compliance standards and issuance timelines
Run regulatory scoping with ADGM/FSRA or VARA and implement AML/KYC/Travel Rule controls
Build wallet and settlement rails; pilot B2B merchant settlement with selected UAE merchants
Add global liquidity partners/market makers and set up fiat on/off-ramps with FAB
Launch remittance corridors and institutional treasury products (yield, sweep, cash management)
Scale to government payments and cross-border trade settlements
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Place risk and build AI solutions with RIQ reinsurance platform
description: IHC launched RIQ, an ADGM-based, AI-native global reinsurance platform with BlackRock and Lunate, backed by over USD 1bn and targeting USD 10bn+ liabilities. Insurers, brokers, data providers, and corporates can collaborate for capacity, analytics, and captives.
example: ADNIC and Oman Insurance can cede MENA commercial property catastrophe layers to RIQ supported by Moody’s RMS models; Aon and Marsh can structure parametric covers (e.g., heat and flood) using RIQ’s AI pricing; large industrials like Emirates Global Aluminium can set up a captive reinsured by RIQ for property/BI; Tractable and Shift Technology can integrate AI FNOL/fraud tools to improve loss ratios for RIQ-bound treaties.
roadmap: Run a capacity needs assessment and identify treaty/program gaps suitable for RIQ
Conduct sandbox pricing pilots with RIQ’s AI models using historic loss data
Structure placements via broker panels; negotiate multi-year capacity and retrocession
Integrate data feeds (IoT/weather/geospatial) to enable parametric triggers
Establish a captive or fronting arrangement if relevant; onboard via ADGM frameworks
Monitor portfolio performance and expand into specialty lines
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Embed Zelo invoice financing into ERP, marketplaces and logistics
description: IHC acquired and rebranded eFunder as Zelo, a digital-first invoice financing platform to serve the UAE’s USD 250bn SME credit gap. ISVs, B2B marketplaces, and logistics firms can embed working capital financing at the point of invoice.
example: Zoho Books and SAP Business One UAE partners can add one-click invoice financing from Zelo within SME ERPs; Tradeling can offer Zelo pay-later terms to vetted buyers, improving GMV and seller cash flow; Aramex and DHL Freight UAE can integrate Zelo to finance receivables for their SME shippers, reducing DSO; Mashreq can provide a senior funding line to Zelo to scale originations while earning secured yield.
roadmap: Sign distribution and referral agreements with ERPs/marketplaces/logistics platforms
Build API integrations for invoice data ingestion and instant eligibility
Secure warehouse funding lines from banks and set risk limits by sector/buyer
Launch pilots with selected merchants and refine underwriting models
Scale to cross-border invoices and add credit insurance overlays
Offer white-label versions for large marketplaces and 3PLs
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Co-lend and build specialized credit products with Reem Finance
description: IHC acquired a 69.33% stake in Reem Finance, strengthening UAE financial services. Lenders, fintechs, and OEMs can develop co-lending, asset finance, and BNPL-for-business products leveraging Reem’s license and balance sheet.
example: Al-Futtaim Automotive can launch vendor finance for commercial fleets where Reem Finance funds up to 80% with telematics-based risk pricing; Property managers can offer receivables financing to tenants via Reem Finance for fit-out and rent deposits; Point-of-sale providers like Paymob can partner with Reem to offer B2B instalments for equipment purchases; Insurance premium finance programs can be co-developed with ADNIC using Reem as the lender.
roadmap: Define product verticals (fleet, equipment, premium finance, fit-out) and target segments
Set up co-lending agreements and credit boxes with partners; integrate via APIs
Arrange funding (bank lines, securitization) and credit insurance for risk transfer
Pilot with anchor OEMs/merchants and iterate underwriting/collections
Scale distribution through channel partners and embedded journeys
Explore ADGM passporting for cross-border programs
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Lease and automate ALMARKAZ logistics assets for GCC distribution
description: Aldar acquired integrated logistics assets in ALMARKAZ from Waha Capital, expanding income-generating logistics real estate across Abu Dhabi, DIP, Jebel Ali and Dubai South. 3PLs, retailers and cold-chain operators can secure space and deploy automation.
example: Maersk Logistics & Services and DHL Supply Chain can take multi-year leases for e-fulfilment hubs and install AutoStore/Swisslog systems; Lulu Group and Noon can set up temperature-controlled distribution centers with Daikin cold-chain solutions; Pharma 3PLs like UPS Healthcare can build GDP-compliant facilities serving GCC lanes.
roadmap: Assess required capacity and target proximity to ports/air cargo (Jebel Ali, Dubai South)
Negotiate lease terms with Aldar for built-to-suit or retrofit units
Design warehouse automation (WMS, AMRs, sortation) and secure equipment vendors
Implement cold-chain or pharma-grade fit-outs if needed
Onboard anchor clients and set SLA frameworks
Expand to bonded and cross-dock facilities as volumes grow
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Provide OPEX services to NMDC Group and Emdad
description: NMDC Group acquired 70% of Emdad, diversifying into recurring OPEX-driven oilfield and industrial services. OEMs, inspection tech firms, and environmental service providers can partner on maintenance, asset integrity, and marine operations.
example: SLB and Baker Hughes can offer rotating equipment maintenance and condition monitoring for ADNOC offshore assets serviced by NMDC/Emdad; Percepto can deploy autonomous drone inspections on offshore platforms and dredgers to reduce downtime; Nalco Water (Ecolab) can supply water treatment chemicals and monitoring for dredging and industrial water systems.
roadmap: Map NMDC/Emdad’s asset base and OPEX needs (mechanical, E&I, integrity, HSE)
Pre-qualify with ADNOC and NMDC vendor lists; secure ICV certification
Propose multi-year service contracts with performance-based pricing
Deploy pilots (predictive maintenance, drone inspections) to demonstrate ROI
Localize spares and service teams in Abu Dhabi and Ras Al Khaimah yards
Expand to regional projects in KSA and Qatar with joint teams
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Scale renewables, smart grids and EV tech with Esyasoft and Good Energy
description: Esyasoft acquired UK-based Good Energy, strengthening capabilities in renewable energy and electric mobility. Utilities, CPOs, and OEMs can partner to roll out smart meters, DER orchestration and EV charging networks in the GCC and UK.
example: ABB E-mobility and Siemens can co-deploy DC fast chargers with Esyasoft software for fleet depots in Abu Dhabi; Octopus Energy can integrate V2G tariffs with Good Energy’s customer base and Esyasoft’s grid data; DEWA or ADDC can pilot advanced metering analytics and demand response with Esyasoft to lower peak load.
roadmap: Define target use cases (smart metering, DERMS, EV charging) and select pilot cities
Co-design hardware-software stacks with interoperability standards (OCPP, OCHP)
Secure grid operator approvals and data-sharing agreements
Install pilot sites and measure load shifting and utilization KPIs
Bundle financing via green loans or leasing for fleet and real-estate owners
Roll out at scale across industrial zones and residential communities
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Partner with PureHealth and HHG for cross-border healthcare
description: PureHealth (IHC portfolio) acquired 60% of Hellenic Healthcare Group, Greece’s largest private healthcare provider. Medtech, health IT, and care operators can deliver centers of excellence, digital health, and medical tourism pathways between UAE and EU.
example: Oracle Health can standardize EHR across HHG facilities and UAE hospitals for shared care records; Medtronic can establish a cardiac center of excellence in Athens with referral pathways from UAE; Etihad Airways and Dnata can create bundled medical travel packages to HHG hospitals for orthopedics and oncology; IQVIA can run pan-EU clinical trials leveraging HHG’s patient base and PureHealth’s UAE network.
roadmap: Identify priority specialties (cardiac, oncology, ortho) and define referral protocols
Assess IT estate and implement interoperable EHR/RCM across entities
Sign OEM and operator MoUs for centers of excellence and training programs
Launch medical travel packages with airlines/insurers and set pricing/quality KPIs
Expand to telemedicine pre/post care and remote monitoring
Develop joint research and clinical trial sites across UAE and Greece
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Expand Tendam retail footprint and omnichannel in Middle East
description: Multiply Group took a 67.91% controlling stake in Tendam, a European fashion retailer. Mall operators, franchise groups, and e-commerce platforms can partner to scale stores and online channels across GCC.
example: Majid Al Futtaim and Alshaya can secure country-level franchise or JV agreements to open Tendam brands in UAE, KSA and Qatar; Noon and Amazon.ae can launch localized Tendam storefronts with next-day delivery; Checkout.com can provide regional payments with local installment options to lift conversion.
roadmap: Conduct market sizing and site selection with GCC mall operators
Negotiate master franchise/JV terms including CAPEX sharing and store rollout targets
Localize e-commerce with Arabic content, COD/BNPL and regional logistics
Launch flagship stores in top-tier malls and parallel D2C online store
Optimize supply chain with bonded warehousing in Jebel Ali and demand forecasting
Expand to outlet formats and cross-border shipping across MENA
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2
